paper.title: Petri Nets with Individual Tokens
paper.venue: Applications and Theory of Petri Nets
paper.abstract: In the well known model of Petri nets (place/transition-nets), actual system states are represented as distributions of “black” tokens onto the places of the nets. Such tokens can not be identified as individual objects. The introduction of individual objects as tokens increases considerably the descriptive power of nets and allows for small but efficient models of real systems.
